page.title: 15MALVERN HILLS CONSERVATORS
page.content: Recently much work has been done hauling marl and soil to re-establish grass on the ridge of the Hills where thousands of visitors have caused {erosion of the soil.}The ancient Third's Wood has been extended and a {plantation}established to commemorate the Queen's Silver Jubilee. Several beech trees have been planted along Jubilee Drive near the mature beech at Brand's Lodge.{Fire breaks and access {paths}have been created and all road and path{verges are mown}to minimise the fire risk. On Herefordshire Beacon {tarmac paths}with Malvern stone edging and steps made from the local stone have encouraged visitors to keep off the{ramparts of the Iron Age Fort.}The ramparts are now restored. The revenue for{landscape conservation}comes from a precept on local ratepayers and partly from car parking fees.
